00040 #ifndef _light_h
00041 #define _light_h
00042 
00043 #include "datatypes.h"
00044 #include "colourvalue.h"
00045 #include "vector3.h"
00046 #include "attachable.h"
00047 
00048 namespace Ogre
00049 {
00050     class Light;
00051 }
00052 
00053 namespace phys
00054 {
00055     class SceneManager;
00056     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00057     /// @class Light
00058     /// @headerfile light.h
00059     /// @brief This class is the class used for dynamic lighting within the scene.
00060     /// @details Dynamic lights come in 3 flavors: @n
00061     /// Directional - Used to simulate light from a very distant source.  Doesn't need a location, only
00062     /// a direction.  Light will hit all objects accordingly from that direction. @n
00063     /// Point - Used to simulate local light sources that emit light in all directions.  Doesn't need a
00064     /// direction, just a position. @n
00065     /// Spotlight - Used to simulate local light sources that emit light in one direction, such as a flashlight.
00066     /// Needs both a position and direction.  In addition needs values for falloff. @n
00067     /// Note: If attaching a light to a node, all transform information(position and orientation) becomes relative
00068     /// to the nodes transform.
00069     ///////////////////////////////////////
00070     class Light : public Attachable
00071     {
00072         public:
00073             enum LightType
00074             {
00075                 Directional,
00076                 Point,
00077                 Spotlight
00078             };
00079         protected:
00080             friend class Node;
00081             /// @brief The ogre light this class gets it's functionality from.
00082             Ogre::Light* OgreLight;
00083             /// @brief Pointer to the manager that created this class.
00084             SceneManager* Manager;
00085         public:
00086             /// @brief Standard initialization constructor.
00087             /// @param Name The name of this light.
00088             /// @param manager Pointer to the manager that this light is to be used in.
00089             Light(const String& Name, SceneManager* manager);
00090             /// @brief Internal Constructor
00091             /// @details This constructor should not be called on manually.
00092             /// @param light The Ogre light this class is based on.
00093             /// @param manager Pointer to the manager that this light is to be used in.
00094             Light(Ogre::Light* light, SceneManager* manager);
00095             /// @brief Class destructor.
00096             ~Light();
00097             /// @brief Gets the name of this light.
00098             /// @return Returns a string containing the name given to this light.
00099             String& GetName();
00100             /// @brief Sets the type of light this light is.
00101             /// @details The light types are listed with the class info.  Types are Directional, Point, and Spotlight.
00102             /// @param Type The enum value representing the type of light this is.
00103             void SetType(Light::LightType Type);
00104             /// @brief Sets the location from where the light will originate.
00105             /// @param Position A vector3 representing the location to set the light.
00106             void SetPosition(Vector3 Position);
00107             /// @brief Sets the direction the light will originate from.
00108             /// @param Direction A vector3 representing the direction the light will come from.
00109             void SetDirection(Vector3 Direction);
00110             /// @brief Sets the colour for the Diffuse light from this source.
00111             /// @details When rendering the final color of an object values of the colours of 3 types of lights are taken into account.
00112             /// The 3 types are: Diffuse, Specular, and Ambient.
00113             /// @param Red Real in the range of 0.0 to 1.0 determining the amount of red in the colour.
00114             /// @param Red green in the range of 0.0 to 1.0 determining the amount of green in the colour.
00115             /// @param Red blue in the range of 0.0 to 1.0 determining the amount of blue in the colour.
00116             void SetDiffuseColour(Real Red, Real Green, Real Blue);
00117             /// @brief Sets the colour for the Diffuse light from this source.
00118             /// @details This allows the setting of Diffuse color by a premade ColourValue.
00119             /// @param Colour ColourValue representing the color of the light to be set.
00120             void SetDiffuseColour(ColourValue &Colour);
00121             /// @brief Sets the colour for the Specular light from this source.
00122             /// @details When rendering the final color of an object values of the colours of 3 types of lights are taken into account.
00123             /// The 3 types are: Diffuse, Specular, and Ambient.
00124             /// @param Red Real in the range of 0.0 to 1.0 determining the amount of red in the colour.
00125             /// @param Red green in the range of 0.0 to 1.0 determining the amount of green in the colour.
00126             /// @param Red blue in the range of 0.0 to 1.0 determining the amount of blue in the colour.
00127             void SetSpecularColour(Real Red, Real Green, Real Blue);
00128             /// @brief Sets the colour for the Specular light from this source.
00129             /// @details This allows the setting of Specular color by a premade ColourValue.
00130             /// @param Colour ColourValue representing the color of the light to be set.
00131             void SetSpecularColour(ColourValue &Colour);
00132             /// @brief Sets the factors for the attenuation formula applied to this light.
00133             /// @details This function is only necessary when using a spotlight or point type of light.
00134             /// @param Range The absolute range of the light in world units.  Objects beyond this range will not be influenced by this light.
00135             /// @param Constant The constant of the attenuation, ranging from 0.0 to 1.0.  1.0 means never attenuate, 0.0 is complete attenuation.
00136             /// @param Linear The linear factor of the attentuation, ranging from 0.0 to 1.0.  1.0 means attenuate evenly over the distance.
00137             /// @param Quadratic The Quadratic factor of the attenuation.  This value adds curvature to the attenuation.
00138             void SetAttenuation(Real Range, Real Constant, Real Linear, Real Quadratic);
00139             /// @brief Defines the cone of light emitted by a spotlight.
00140             /// @details InnerAngle and OuterAngle should be input as Radians.
00141             /// @param InnerAngle Angle of the inner cone.
00142             /// @param OuterAngle Angle of the outer cone.
00143             /// @param Falloff The rate of falloff between the inner and outer cones.  1.0 means linear falloff.
00144             /// Less means slower falloff and higher means faster falloff.
00145             void SetSpotlightRange(Real InnerAngle, Real OuterAngle, Real Falloff=1.0);
00146             /// @brief Sets the Inner angle of the cone of light emitted by a spotlight.
00147             /// @param InnerAngle Angle of the inner cone.
00148             void SetSpotlightInnerAngle(Real InnerAngle);
00149             /// @brief Sets the Outer angle of the cone of light emitted by a spotlight.
00150             /// @param OuterAngle Angle of the outer cone.
00151             void SetSpotlightOuterAngle(Real OuterAngle);
00152             /// @brief Sets the rate of falloff of the cone of light emitted by a spotlight.
00153             /// @param Falloff The rate of falloff between the inner and outer cones.  1.0 means linear falloff.
00154             /// Less means slower falloff and higher means faster falloff.
00155             void SetSpotlightFalloff(Real Falloff);
00156             /// @brief Sets the lights power scale.
00157             /// @details The power scale of the light is a scaling factor indicating the relative power of the light.
00158             /// @param Power Real representing the factor by which to scale the power of the light.
00159             void SetPowerScale(Real Power);
00160             /// @brief Gets the type of light that this light is.
00161             /// @return Returns an enum value for this lights type.
00162             Light::LightType GetType();
00163             /// @brief Gets the current location of the light.
00164             /// @return Returns a vector3 representing the location of the light.
00165             Vector3 GetPosition();
00166             /// @brief Gets the currently set direction of the light.
00167             /// @return Returns a vector3 representing the set direction of the light.
00168             Vector3 GetDirection();
00169             /// @brief Gets the current colour of the diffuse light.
00170             /// @return Returns a colourvalue representing the currently set Diffuse light.
00171             ColourValue GetDiffuseColour();
00172             /// @brief Gets the current colour of the specular light.
00173             /// @return Returns a colourvalue representing the currently set Specular light.
00174             ColourValue GetSpecularColour();
00175             /// @brief Gets the absolute range of attenuation in world units.
00176             /// @return Returns a real representing the absolute range of attenuation.
00177             Real GetAttenuationRange();
00178             /// @brief Gets the constant factor of the attenuation.
00179             /// @return Returns a real representing the constant factor of attenuation.
00180             Real GetAttenuationConstant();
00181             /// @brief Gets the linear factor of the attentuation.
00182             /// @return Returns a real representing the linear factor of attenuation.
00183             Real GetAttenuationLinear();
00184             /// @brief Gets the quadric factor of the attenuation.
00185             /// @return Returns a real representing the quadric factor of attenuation.
00186             Real GetAttenuationQuadric();
00187             /// @brief Gets the Inner angle of the cone of light emitted by this spotlight.
00188             /// @return Returns a real representing the inner angle of this spotlight, in radians.
00189             Real GetSpotlightInnerAngle();
00190             /// @brief Gets the Outer angle of the cone of light emitted by this spotlight.
00191             /// @return Returns a real representing the outer angle of this spotlight, in radians.
00192             Real GetSpotlightOuterAngle();
00193             /// @brief Gets the rate of falloff of the cone of light emitted by this spotlight.
00194             /// @return Returns a real representing the falloff of the cone of light.
00195             Real GetSpotlightFalloff();
00196             /// @brief Gets the lights power scale.
00197             /// @return Returns a real representing the power scale of the light.
00198             Real GetPowerScale();
00199     };
00200 }//phys
00201 
00202 #endif
